results.title: To the rescue
results.brief_description: Air Ambulance: Saskatchewan’s air ambulance service brings quick relief to the sick or injured. Rocky Mountain Rescue: Rescue techniques used by park wardens and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police to aid stranded or injured mountain climbers are demonstrated. Avalanche Experts: In the Canadian Rockies the experts often anticipate and prevent avalanches.

results.title: To the Lighthouse
results.brief_description: A film adaptation of Virginia Woolf’s most popular novel. Set in a delightful holiday home in Cornwall overlooked by a distant lighthouse which holds a haunting attraction for members of this Edwardian family. A compelling story of family relationships.

results.title: To the island (Macquarie Island)
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Examines the wildlife on sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island, including seals, penguins, skuas, petrels, cape pigeons etc. Culminates in closeup views of the light-mantled sooty albatross and the synchronous courtship flight of a pair of these birds.

results.title: To the edge of the universe [short version]
results.creator_credit: Grant Crabtree, Dennis Sawyer, Douglas Cameron and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An account of the construction, in Algonquin Park, Ontario, of a radiotelescope designed by Canada’s National Research Council. Working simultaneously with the telescope of the Dominion Radio Astrophysical Observatory at Penticton, British Columbia, it was used to measure the first arc of a quasar (quasi-stellar radio source) at the outermost fringe of our universe. The success of this probe opened up new possibilities of astronomical enquiry.

results.title: To the count of Basie
results.creator_credit: Angus Trowbridge, John Jeremy, Severiges Television-TV1, Osterreichischer Rundfunk-Fernsehen and TCB
results.brief_description: A documentary exploring the life and music of the legendary Count Basie. Using rare footage from the 30s and 40s and interviews with his favourite musicians and admirers, this tribute recalls the Count’s famous numbers (“One o’clock jump, Jumping at the Woodside, Every tub, The Kid from Red Bank, Doggin’ around, Little darlin’, April in Paris) and reveals the personality behind them. Count Basie himself tells of the early influence of Fats Waller and Pete Johnson and his first barnstorming days in Kansas City. Suitable for middle and upper secondary, and tertiary levels.

results.title: To taste 100 herbs: gods, ancestors and medicine (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
A rich portrait of a traditional Chinese doctor and his special role in the community. The doctor discusses his Catholic religion, medical ethics, rural health services, handed-down knowledge of herbal treatments and Western medical practices. The warmth, closeness and traditions of family life in China are wonderfully captured in scenes of prayer, play, chores and celebrations.

results.title: To speak or not to speak
results.creator_credit: Raoul Servais and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: A grim animated satire on politics and the media - man’s general lack on knowledge on one and his dependence on the other. An allegory on the dangers of political apathy demonstrating that people who lack knowledge of their political affairs are ripe for manipulation or takeover by special interests or totalitarian governments. Animated by Willy Verschelde, background by Norbert Deseyn. Non-narrated.
